intro: Ardisia cartagoana, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or red beauty, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Myrsinaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible but often have a tart flavor. Ardisia cartagoana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
